net.sf.mmm.util.version.base

Class AbstractVersionIdentifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.version.base.AbstractVersionIdentifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<VersionIdentifier>, AttributeReadValue<String>, Datatype, SimpleDatatype<String>, VersionIdentifier
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    VersionIdentifierImpl

    public abstract class AbstractVersionIdentifier
extends Object
implements VersionIdentifier
    This is the abstract base implementation of VersionIdentifier.
    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getVersionMajorSegment

        public int getVersionMajorSegment()
        Description copied from interface: VersionIdentifier
        This method gets the major segment of this VersionIdentifier. This is the most significant segment of the version. It only gets updated on significant functional and/or structural changes of the versioned artifact. An upgrade can cause appreciable manual effort and will often cause compatibility problems and require migration of data or configuration.
        Specified by:
        getVersionMajorSegment in interface VersionIdentifier
        Returns:
        the major version segment.
        See Also:
        VersionIdentifier.VERSION_SEGMENT_INDEX_MAJOR

      • getVersionMinorSegment

        public int getVersionMinorSegment()
        Description copied from interface: VersionIdentifier
        This method gets the minor segment of this VersionIdentifier. This is the second most significant segment of the version. It only gets updated on functional and/or structural changes of the versioned artifact. An upgrade should be supported but may cause compatibility problems and require migration of data or configuration.
        Specified by:
        getVersionMinorSegment in interface VersionIdentifier
        Returns:
        the minor version segment.
        See Also:
        VersionIdentifier.VERSION_SEGMENT_INDEX_MINOR

      • getVersionMilliSegment

        public int getVersionMilliSegment()
        Description copied from interface: VersionIdentifier
        This method gets the milli segment of this VersionIdentifier. This is the third most significant segment of the version. It only gets updated on small functional and/or structural changes of the versioned artifact. An upgrade should not cause problems but needs to be tested.
        Specified by:
        getVersionMilliSegment in interface VersionIdentifier
        Returns:
        the milli version segment.
        See Also:
        VersionIdentifier.VERSION_SEGMENT_INDEX_MILLI

      • getVersionMicroSegment

        public int getVersionMicroSegment()
        Description copied from interface: VersionIdentifier
        This method gets the micro segment of this VersionIdentifier. This is the fourth most significant segment of the version. It only gets updated on small internal changes (e.g. bugfixes) of the versioned artifact. An upgrade should not cause problems.
        Specified by:
        getVersionMicroSegment in interface VersionIdentifier
        Returns:
        the milli version segment.
        See Also:
        VersionIdentifier.VERSION_SEGMENT_INDEX_MICRO

      • compareToLinear

        private <T extends Comparable<T>> int compareToLinear(int currentResult,
                                                      T thisValue,
                                                      T otherValue,
                                                      VersionIdentifier otherVersion)
        This method performs the part of compareTo(VersionIdentifier) for linear and optional attributes like VersionIdentifier.getTimestamp() or VersionIdentifier.getRevision().
        Type Parameters:
        T - is the generic type of the Comparable value.
        Parameters:
        currentResult - is the current result so far.
        thisValue - is the value of this VersionIdentifier.
        otherValue - is the value of the other VersionIdentifier.
        otherVersion - is the VersionIdentifier to compare to.
        Returns:
        the result of comparison.

      • compareTo

        public final int compareTo(VersionIdentifier otherVersion)
        Description copied from interface: VersionIdentifier
        This method determines a (non-linear) distance from this version to the given otherVersion. It will return
        • VersionIdentifier.COMPARE_TO_INCOMPARABLE if both versions are incompatible to each other (e.g. ).
        • 0 if both versions are historically equivalent (but may NOT be equal)
        • a negative value if this version is a predecessor of otherVersion. The value -1 indicates a strict predecessor.
        • a positive value if this version is a successor of otherVersion. The value +1 indicates a strict successor.
        The following table gives some examples:
        version otherVersion version.compareTo(otherVersion)
        1.0.0-SNAPSHOT 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT 0
        1.0.0 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT 1 (VersionIdentifier.COMPARE_TO_STRICT_SUCCESSOR)
        1.0.1 1.0.0 1 (VersionIdentifier.COMPARE_TO_STRICT_SUCCESSOR)
        1.0.1 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT >1
        1.6.0u23 1.6.0u24 -1 (VersionIdentifier.COMPARE_TO_STRICT_PREDECESSOR)
        3.7-SR1-indigo 4.1.1-201109121510 <-1
        3.7.1-helios 3.7.1-indigo VersionIdentifier.COMPARE_TO_INCOMPARABLE
        1.0-20000101T000000Z 1.0-19991231T235959Z VersionIdentifier.COMPARE_TO_INCOMPARABLE
        1.0-20000101T000000Z 1.1-19991231T235959Z VersionIdentifier.COMPARE_TO_INCOMPARABLE
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<VersionIdentifier>
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface VersionIdentifier

        public String getValue()
        Description copied from interface: SimpleDatatype

        Specified by:

        Specified by:

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Description copied from interface: VersionIdentifier
        This method gets a unique string representation of this VersionIdentifier. Returns the official String representation of this Datatype. While the general contract of Object.toString() is very weak and mainly used for debugging, the contract here is very strong. The returned String has to be suitable for end-users and official output to any kind of sink.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is not supposed to do internationalization (I18N). See NlsMessage for this purpose and implement NlsObject if you want to support I18N/L10N.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Datatype
        Specified by:
        toString in interface VersionIdentifier
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        the official String representation to display the value of this Datatype.
